newsitem.title: UK: No sign competition hit in UK paper retailing - OFT.
newsitem.headline: No sign competition hit in UK paper retailing - OFT.

text.p: The Office of Fair Trading said on Wednesday it expected to decide by the end of April whether to refer complaints by newsagents about higher carriage charges and proportionately lower retail margins to the Monopolies and Mergers Commission.
But director general John Bridgeman said he had seen no signs as yet of harm to competition as a result of the moves by newspaper publishers and wholesalers.
"As yet there are no adverse effects that we identify," Bridgeman told parliament's Trade and Industry Committee.
"I believe strongly that the industry's problems are best dealt with through industry discussions. I still believe that this is the best way forward," he added.

The National Federation of Retail Newsagents and the Multiple Newsagents Association have called for a reference to the MMC, arguing that the effect of changing contract conditions on their members has been exacerbated by the entry of supermarkets and filling stations into the market.
